required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Duloxetine for Postoperative Pain of Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Duloxetine Efficacy and Tolerability for Pain Management in Patients Undergoing Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy

collaborator.agency: National Hepatology & Tropical Medicine Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock: Recent studies on the impact of perioperative duloxetine for treatment of acute postoperative pain have yielded positive outcomes with respect to reduction opioid consumption. The aim of the present study is to investigate the role of perioperative duloxetine on the management of postoperative pain in patients undergoing LC.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in postoperative pain between the two groups using visual analogue score (VAS)
primary_outcome.description: pain will be assessed using visual analogue score (VAS) 0-100 mm (0 indicated no pain, 100 denoted the most severe pain)

secondary_outcome.description: will be assessed using PONV scale a 4-point scale: none (0): no nausea, vomiting, and retching; mild (1): happened once; moderate (2): happened 2-3 times; and severe (3): continuous or more than three times.

arm_group.description: patients scheduled for elective LC will receive 60 mg duloxetine before surgery
patients scheduled for elective LC will receive placebo before surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1. Patients who are scheduled to undergo elective LC
Exclusion Criteria:
1- Patients with acute pancreatitis 2. Patients undergoing chronic pain treatment 3. Patients who received analgesics or sedatives 24 h before scheduled surgery 3. Patients had alcohol or drug addiction 4. Severe hepatic and renal dysfunction 5. Previous allergic response to duloxetine 6. Pregnancy and lactation 7. Patients with communication problems, cognitive dysfunction, or psychological disorders
